intro: Hieracium dermophyllum subsp. ortiganum, commonly known as the Ortiganum hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow daisy-like flowers and hairy stems, which are typical features of the genus Hieracium. This subspecies is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. It has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and can grow up to 30 cm in height. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
